articles.headline: Business Background Defines Chief of Staff
articles.snippet: The recruitment of William M. Daley from the corporate board room is seen as savvy by some in Washington, but it is causing alarm in the president’s liberal base.
articles.abstract: The recruitment of William M. Daley from the corporate board room is seen as savvy by some in Washington, but it is causing alarm in the president’s liberal base.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  He is a top executive at JPMorgan Chase, where he is paid as much as $5 million a year and supervises the Washington lobbying efforts of the nation’s second-largest bank. He also serves on the board of directors at Boeing, the giant military contractor, and Abbott Laboratories, the global drug company, which has billions of dollars at stake in the overhaul of the health care system.

articles.headline: Pentagon Seeks Biggest Military Cuts Since Before 9/11
articles.snippet: The White House ordered the Pentagon to squeeze almost all growth from its spending over the next five years, Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates said.
articles.abstract: The White House ordered the Pentagon to squeeze almost all growth from its spending over the next five years, Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates said Thursday that the nation’s “extreme fiscal duress” now required him to call for cuts in the size of the Army and Marine Corps, reversing the significant growth in military spending that followed the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, 2001.
articles.byline: By Thom Shanker and Christopher Drew

articles.headline: Blast Awakens Egyptians to Threat From Religious Strife
articles.snippet: A fatal blast at a church has forced leaders to acknowledge that Egypt is plagued by religious extremism that could undermine stability.
articles.abstract: A fatal blast at a church has forced leaders to acknowledge that Egypt is plagued by religious extremism that could undermine stability.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO  A deadly suicide bomb attack outside a Christian church in Alexandria on Saturday has forced the government and religious leaders here to acknowledge that Egypt is increasingly plagued by a sectarian divide that could undermine the stability that has been a hallmark of President Hosni Mubarak’s nearly three decades in power.

articles.headline: Toyota Aims to Remain King of the Hybrids
articles.snippet: Toyota will introduce an addition to the Prius lineup of gas-electric vehicles at the Detroit auto show.
articles.abstract: Toyota will introduce an addition to the Prius lineup of gas-electric vehicles at the Detroit auto show.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO  As Toyota heads to the Detroit auto show that opens Monday, the company aims to burnish its reputation as a leader in environmental technology  an image increasingly under threat from resurgent rivals.

articles.headline: MBIA Fights Banks for Its Life
articles.snippet: Courts will be deciding the fate of MBIA, which claims some banks owe it money because they lied about the mortgages backing securities that MBIA insured.
articles.abstract: Courts will be deciding the fate of MBIA, which claims some banks owe it money because they lied about the mortgages backing securities that MBIA insured.
articles.lead_paragraph: MBIA, an insurance company whose very existence is imperiled because it underestimated the risks involved in mortgage lending, says the banks owe it billions because they lied about the mortgages backing securities that MBIA insured. The insurer’s financial statements show it is solvent in large part because that money will be coming in.

articles.headline: The Downsizing in Detroit
articles.snippet: The Big Three automakers have made strides in fuel economy but still rely on light trucks and S.U.V.’s for profits.
articles.abstract: The Big Three automakers have made strides in fuel economy but still rely on light trucks and S.U.V.’s for profits.
articles.lead_paragraph: WAYNE, Mich.  Ten years ago, the Ford Motor plant here churned out giant Expedition and Navigator sport utility vehicles that got 12 miles to the gallon  and it was one of the most profitable auto factories in the world.

articles.headline: With Android Phones, Verizon Is in Position to Gain Lost Ground
articles.snippet: Verizon, which passed on becoming the initial carrier for the iPhone, now stands to gain by carrying iPhones and Android phones on an expanded 4G network.
articles.abstract: Verizon, which passed on becoming the initial carrier for the iPhone, now stands to gain by carrying iPhones and Android phones on an expanded 4G network.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Five years ago, Verizon passed on the chance to be the exclusive carrier of the iPhone in the United States because it could not agree on the terms of a deal with Apple.

articles.headline: U.S. Sends Warning to People Named in Cable Leaks
articles.snippet: Officials say hundreds of rights activists, foreign officials and businesspeople have been warned of potential threats.
articles.abstract: Officials say hundreds of rights activists, foreign officials and businesspeople have been warned of potential threats.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The State Department is warning hundreds of human rights activists, foreign government officials and businesspeople identified in leaked diplomatic cables of potential threats to their safety and has moved a handful of them to safer locations, administration officials said Thursday.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Scott Shane

articles.headline: U.S. Inquiry Said to Focus on California Pension Fund
articles.snippet: The S.E.C. is said to be investigating whether California violated securities laws and failed to provide adequate disclosure about its fund.
articles.abstract: The S.E.C. is said to be investigating whether California violated securities laws and failed to provide adequate disclosure about its fund.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal regulators are investigating whether California violated securities laws and failed to provide adequate disclosure about its giant public pension fund, according to a person with knowledge of the investigation.
articles.byline: By Mary Williams Walsh and Louise Story

articles.headline: Slow Job Growth Dims Expectation of Early Revival
articles.snippet: The rate of growth — 103,000 jobs in December — is an indication that the unemployment rate will likely remain high through the rest of President Obama’s four-year term.
articles.abstract: The rate of growth — 103,000 jobs in December — is an indication that the unemployment rate will likely remain high through the rest of President Obama’s four-year term.
articles.lead_paragraph: The year 2010 ended on a disappointing note, as the economy added just 103,000 jobs in December, suggesting that economic deliverance will not arrive with a great pop in employment.
articles.byline: By Michael Powell and Sewell Chan
